FacilityName: Airgas USA, LLC - Ponca City, OK

_prev_prog_3.EquipmentTested: Process pumps, valve actuators, fill scales, ball valves, check valves, emergency shutoff switches, fill hose, gauges, pressure relief devices, compressors, vapor or liquid gas piping

_exec_summary.SummaryText:
RMP: Executive Summary [68.155] 



2.5 Has the owner or operator included a brief description of the following elements in the executive summary of the RMP: [68.155]

 

2.5.1 The accidental release prevention and emergency response policies at the stationary source? [68.155(a)]



The accidental release prevention and emergency response policies for the stationary source are located in the Volume 2 Process Safety and Risk Management Manual.  Airgas' Process Safety and Risk Management Program provides instructions for implementing processes that produce employee participation, RMP related deliverables, and training activities that are compliant with 40 CFR Part 68.



2.5.2 The stationary source and regulated substances handled? [68.155(b)]



Propylene is the regulated substance that is managed at the Airgas USA, LLC Mid South fill plant in Ponca City, OK.  Airgas Mid South trucks pick up returned (empty) propylene cylinders from customer locations and transport the returned cylinders to the stationary source.  Propylene is stored at the stationary source in a large bulk tank.  Propylene is transferred from the propylene bulk tank into propylene cylinders.  The full propylene cylinders are distributed by Airgas Mid South to customers.



2.5.3 The general accidental release prevention program and chemical-specific prevention steps? [68.155(c)]



The accidental release prevention and emergency response policies for the stationary source are located in the Volume 2 Process Safety and Risk Management Manual.  Airgas' Process Safety and Risk Management Program provides instructions for implementing accidental release prevention processes that are specific to propylene and that are compliant with 40 CFR Part 68.



2.5.4 The five-year accident history? [68.155(d)]



At the time this Executive Summary was written, the covered process had not been involved with an accidental release that could have lead to property damage, catastrophic consequence, injury, or death wit

hin the past 5 years.  In addition, an accidental release had not lead to a response or restoration activity for an exposure of an environmental receptor.  Refer to Volume 2 Process Safety and Risk Management Manual Appendix Tab 222 for additional information or if applicable, updated information.





2.5.5 The emergency response program? [68.155(e)]



Employees of the stationary source will not respond to accidental releases of regulated substances.  The stationary source has an evacuation plan and has coordinated emergency response activities with local emergency responders.  Refer to Volume 2 Process Safety and Risk Management Manual Appendix Tab 2280 and Appendix Tab 3120 for additional information.





2.5.6 Planned changes to improve safety? [68.155(f)]



Implementation of the RMP processes produced many changes that improved safety.  Please refer to the PSM/RMP Corrective Action/Improvement Log for additional information. During the most recent Process Hazard Analysis review (September 13, 2016), which included a thorough review of process equipment and procedures, a number of action items were identified to improve the overall safety for this facility.  Future improvements will be summarized on the PSM/RMP Corrective Action/Improvement Log.
